meanings.definition: The art or process of printing with type.
meanings.sent1: Learning about typographies helps us understand how books are made.
meanings.sent2: The typographies in this magazine are very clear and easy to read.
meanings.sent3: The typographies at the printing press decided to have a race to see who could finish first.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a jumble of different typographies, each representing a different thought.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used colorful typographies to make the lesson more engaging.

meanings.definition: The style and appearance of printed matter.
meanings.sent1: The typographies of this poster are bold and eye-catching.
meanings.sent2: She studied different typographies to improve her graphic design skills.
meanings.sent3: The typographies at the party were so fancy that they outshone the decorations.
meanings.sent4: His typographies were like a window into his creative mind.
meanings.sent5: The typographies of the book cover drew me in immediately.

meanings.definition: The arrangement and design of printed material.
meanings.sent1: Good typographies can make a document easier to read and understand.
meanings.sent2: The typographies of the brochure were carefully chosen to convey professionalism.
meanings.sent3: The typographies on the menu seemed to be dancing around, trying to catch the diner's attention.
meanings.sent4: Her typographies were like a well-orchestrated symphony on the page.
meanings.sent5: The typographies of the advertisement were so captivating that I couldn't look away.
